name: Ki Rush
shortDesc: Accelerated by your ki, you move with such speed you become a blur.
desc: Accelerated by your ki, you move with such speed you become a blur. Move two times: two Strides, two Steps, or one Stride and one Step (in either order). You gain the concealed condition during this movement and until the start of your next turn.

name: Ki Strike
shortDesc: You focus your ki into magical attacks.
desc: You focus your ki into magical attacks. Make an unarmed Strike or Flurry of Blows (this doesn't change the limit on using only one flourish per turn). You gain a +1 status bonus to your attack rolls with the Strikes, and the Strikes deal <var>var1</var>  extra damage. This damage can be any of the following types of your choice, chosen each time you Strike: force, lawful (only if you're lawful), negative, or positive.
heightened/0/desc: The extra damage increases by 1d6.

name: Force Bolt
shortDesc: You fire an unerring dart of force from your fingertips.
desc: You fire an unerring dart of force from your fingertips. It automatically hits and deals <var>var1</var> force damage to the target.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 1d4+1.

name: Lingering Composition
shortDesc: You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits.
desc: You add a flourish to your composition to extend its benefits. If your next action is to cast a cantrip composition with a duration of 1 round, attempt a Performance check. The DC is usually a standard-difficulty DC of a level equal to the highest-level target of your composition, but the GM can assign a different DC based on the circumstances. The effect depends on the result of your check.
failure: The composition lasts 1 round, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.

name: Counter Performance
shortDesc: Your performance protects you and your allies.
trigger: You or an ally within 60 feet rolls a saving throw against an auditory or visual effect.
desc: Your performance protects you and your allies. Roll a Performance check for a type you know: an auditory performance if the trigger was auditory, or a visual one for a visual trigger. You and allies in the area can use the better result between your Performance check and the saving throw.
failure: The composition lasts 1 round, but you don't spend the Focus Point for casting this spell.

name: Inspire Courage
shortDesc: Your performance protects you and your allies.
desc: You inspire your allies with words or tunes of encouragement. You and all allies in the area gain a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, damage rolls, and saves against fear effects.

name: Wholeness of Body
shortDesc: You focus your ki to heal yourself.
desc:
You heal yourself in one of the following ways, chosen by you when you cast the spell.

You regain <var>var1</var> Hit Points.
You attempt to cure one poison or disease afflicting you; attempt to counteract the affliction.
heightened/0/desc: If you choose to regain Hit Points, the Hit Points regained increase by 8.

name: Ki Blast
shortDesc: You unleash your ki as a powerful blast of force.
desc: You unleash your ki as a powerful blast of force that deals <var>var1</var> force damage. If you use 2 actions to cast ki blast, increase the size of the cone to 30 feet and the damage to <var>var2</var>. If you use 3 actions to cast ki blast, increase the size of the cone to 60 feet and the damage to <var>var3</var>. Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude saving throw.
failure: The creature takes full damage and is pushed 5 feet.
critfailure: The creature takes double damage and is pushed 10 feet.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 1d6, or by 2d6 if you use 2 or 3 actions.

name: Abundant Step
shortDesc: You move so fast you blur across planar boundaries.
desc: You move so fast you blur across planar boundaries. You teleport up to a distance equal to your Speed within your line of sight.

name: Wild Winds Stance
shortDesc: You take on the stance of the flowing winds, sending out waves of energy at a distance.
desc:
You take on the stance of the flowing winds, sending out waves of energy at a distance. You can make wind crash unarmed Strikes as ranged Strikes against targets within 30 feet. These deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage, use the brawling group, and have the agile, nonlethal, propulsive, and unarmed traits. Wind crash Strikes ignore concealment and all cover.

While in wild winds stance, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

name: Wind Jump
shortDesc: You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed.
desc: You gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed. You must end your turn on solid ground, or you fall.<var>var1</var>
heightened/0/desc: At the end of your turn, you can attempt a DC 30 Acrobatics check to find purchase in midair. If you succeed, you don't fall.
desc6/0/value: At the end of your turn, you can attempt a DC 30 Acrobatics check to find purchase in midair. If you succeed, you don't fall.

name: Quivering Palm
shortDesc: Your strikes can kill foes with a precise and powerful strike.
desc:
Make a melee unarmed Strike. If you hit and the target is alive, anytime during the duration, you can spend a single action, which has the auditory and concentrate traits, to speak a word of death that could instantly slay it. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

If you cast quivering palm again, the effects of any quivering palm you had previously cast end.
critsuccess: The target survives, the spell ends, and the target is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
success: The target is stunned 1 and takes <var>var1</var> damage, the spell ends, and the target is then temporarily immune for 24 hours.
failure: The target is stunned 3 and takes <var>var2</var> damage. The spell's duration continues, but the target is then temporarily immune for 24 hours against being killed by quivering palm.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 10 on a failure, or 5 on a success.

name: Empty Body
shortDesc: You turn ethereal, with the effects of ethereal jaunt, but you don't need to concentrate.
desc: You turn ethereal, with the effects of ethereal jaunt, but you don't need to concentrate.

name: Acid Splash
shortDesc: Damage creatures with acid.
desc: You splash a glob of acid that splatters creatures and objects alike. Make a spell attack. If you hit, you deal <var>var1</var> acid damage plus <var>var2</var> splash acid damage. On a critical success, the target also takes <var>var3</var> persistent acid damage.
heightened/0/desc: The initial damage increases to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier, and the persistent damage increases to 2.
heightened/1/desc: The initial damage increases to 2d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier, the persistent damage increases to 3, and the splash damage increases to 2.
heightened/2/desc: The initial damage increases to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier, the persistent damage increases to 4, and the splash damage increases to 3.
heightened/3/desc: The initial damage increases to 4d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier, the persistent damage increases to 5, and the splash damage increases to 4.

name: Chill Touch
shortDesc: Your touch hurts the living or disorients undead.
desc:
Siphoning negative energy into yourself, your hand radiates a pale darkness. Your touch weakens the living and disorients undead, possibly even causing them to flee. The effect depends on whether the target is living or undead.

Living Creature The spell deals negative damage equal to <var>var1</var> plus your spellcasting modifier. The target attempts a basic Fortitude save, but is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round on a critical failure.
Undead Creature The target is flat-footed for 1 round on a failed Fortitude save. On a critical failure, the target is also fleeing for 1 round unless it succeeds at a Will save.
heightened/0/desc: The negative damage to living creatures increases by 1d4.

name: Dancing Lights
shortDesc: Create four floating lights you can move.
desc: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

name: Daze
shortDesc: Damage a creature's mind and possibly stun it.
desc: You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to <var>var1</var>your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also stunned 1.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 1d6.

name: Detect Magic
shortDesc: Sense whether magic is nearby.
desc:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. <var>var1</var> You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.
heightened/0/desc: You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.
heightened/1/desc: As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).
desc1/0/value: You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic.
desc3/0/value: You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.
desc4/0/value: You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range and pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic that the spell detects. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that). If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

name: Disrupt Undead
shortDesc: Damage undead with positive energy.

name: Divine Lance
shortDesc: Throw divine energy that damages based on your deity's alignment.

name: Electric Arc
shortDesc: Zap one or two creatures with lightning.
desc: An arc of lightning leaps from one target to another. You deal electricity damage equal to <var>var1</var> plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
heightened/0/desc: Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

name: Forbidding Ward
shortDesc: Protect an ally against one specific enemy.
desc: You ward an ally against the attacks and hostile spells from the target enemy. The target ally gains a <var>var1</var> status bonus to Armor Class and saving throws against the target enemy's attacks, spells, and other effects.
heightened/0/desc: The status bonus increases to +2.

name: Ghost Sound
shortDesc: Make false sounds.
desc: <var>var1</var>You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).
heightened/0/desc: The range increases to 60 feet.

name: Guidance
shortDesc: Divine guidance improves one roll.
duration: until the start of your next turn
desc: You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

name: Join Pasts
shortDesc: Share thoughts and experiences with allies.
desc: <var>var1</var>With touches to the targets’ foreheads, you bring them into mental communion. The targets can share thoughts and experiences, but not words. When one target attempts to Recall Knowledge, the other can Aid the first target’s skill check, using any Lore skill (even if that Lore wouldn’t normally apply) without having made any preparations to Aid.
heightened/0/desc: You can touch one additional target to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc2/0/value: You can touch one additional target to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc3/0/value: You can touch two additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc4/0/value: You can touch three additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc5/0/value: You can touch four additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc6/0/value: You can touch five additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc7/0/value: You can touch six additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc8/0/value: You can touch seven additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc9/0/value: You can touch eight additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.
desc10/0/value: You can touch nine additional targets to include them in the spell’s effects. Multiple targets can attempt checks to Aid the target who is attempting to Recall Knowledge.

name: Know Direction
shortDesc: Find true north.
desc: In your mind's eye, you see a path northward. You immediately know which direction is north (if it exists at your current location). <var>var1</var>
heightened/0/desc: You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.
desc7/0/value: You can instead know the direction to a familiar location, such as a previous home or a favorite tavern.

name: Light
shortDesc: Make an object glow.
targets: 1 object of 1 Bulk or less, either unattended or possessed by you or a willing ally
duration: until the next time you make your daily preparations
desc: The object glows, casting bright light in a <var>var1</var>-foot radius (and dim light for the next <var>var2</var> feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.
heightened/0/desc: The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

name: Mage Hand
shortDesc: Command a floating hand to move an object.
targets: 1 unattended object of light Bulk or less
desc: <var>var1</var>You create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because you're levitating the object, you can move it in any direction. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.
heightened/0/desc: You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
heightened/1/desc: The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
heightened/2/desc: The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.
desc3/0/value: You can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
desc5/0/value: The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
desc7/0/value: The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.

name: Message
shortDesc: Speak a message to a distant creature, who can reply.
desc: <var>var1</var>You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.
heightened/0/desc: The spell's range increases to 500 feet.
desc3/0/value: The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

name: Prestidigitation
shortDesc: Perform a minor magical trick.
desc:
The simplest magic does your bidding. You can perform simple magical effects for as long as you Sustain the Spell. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can choose one of four options.

Cook: Cool, warm, or flavor 1 pound of nonliving material.
Lift: Slowly lift an unattended object of light Bulk or less 1 foot off the ground.
Make: Create a temporary object of negligible Bulk, made of congealed magical substance. The object looks crude and artificial and is extremely fragile—it can't be used as a tool, weapon, or spell component.
Tidy: Color, clean, or soil an object of light Bulk or less. You can affect an object of 1 Bulk with 10 rounds of concentration, and a larger object a 1 minute per Bulk.

Prestidigitation can't deal damage or cause adverse conditions. Any actual change to an object (beyond what is noted above) persists only as long as you Sustain the Spell.

name: Produce Flame
shortDesc: Kindle small flames to attack close or at range.
desc: A small ball of flame appears in the palm of your hand, and you lash out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against your target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but you can also make a melee attack against a creature in your unarmed reach. On a success, you deal <var>var1</var> fire damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and <var>var2</var> persistent fire damage.
heightened/0/desc: Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

name: Ray of Frost
shortDesc: Damage a creature with cold.
desc: You blast an icy ray. Make a spell attack roll. The ray deals cold damage equal to <var>var1</var> plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
critsuccess: The target takes double damage and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 1 round.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 1d4.

name: Read Aura
shortDesc: Detect if an object is magical, and determine the school of its magic.
desc:
<var>var1</var>You focus on the target object, opening your mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, you know whether that item is magical, and if it is, you learn the school of magic.

If the object is illusory, you detect this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of your read aura spell.
heightened/0/desc: You can target up to 10 objects.
heightened/1/desc: You can target any number of objects.
desc3/0/value: You can target up to 10 objects.
desc6/0/value: You can target any number of objects.

name: Shield
shortDesc: A shield of magical force blocks attacks and magic missiles.
internalNote: The shield's hardness increase is hardcoded.
duration: until the start of your next turn
desc:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the Shield Block reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness <var>var1</var>. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.
heightened/0/desc: The shield has Hardness 10.

name: Sigil
shortDesc: Leave a magical mark.
internalNote: The effect is not implemented and will not be implemented.
desc: You harmlessly place your unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and you can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. <var>var1</var>The time before the mark fades increases depending on your heightened level.
heightened/0/desc: The sigil instead fades after 1 month.
heightened/1/desc: The sigil instead fades after 1 year.
desc1/0/value: If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week.
desc3/0/value: If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of 1 month.
desc5/0/value: If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of 1 year.

name: Stabilize
shortDesc: Stabilize a dying creature.

name: Tanglefoot
shortDesc: Conjure a vine to entangle a creature.
desc: A vine covered in sticky sap appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack against the target.
critsuccess: The target gains the immobilized condition and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for <var>var1</var>. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the immobilized condition.
success: The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for <var>var1</var>. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.
heightened/0/desc: The effects last for 2 rounds.

name: Telekinetic Projectile
shortDesc: Fling an object at a creature.
desc: You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack against the target. If you hit, you deal bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage—as appropriate for the object you hurled—equal to <var>var1</var> plus your spellcasting ability modifier. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 1d6.

name: Acidic Burst
shortDesc: You create a shell of acid around yourself that immediately bursts outward.
desc: You create a shell of acid around yourself that immediately bursts outward, dealing <var>var1</var> acid damage to each creature in the area.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Agitate
shortDesc: You send the target's mind and body into overdrive, forcing it to become restless and hyperactive.
desc: You send the target’s mind and body into overdrive, forcing it to become restless and hyperactive. During the duration, the target must Stride at least once each turn or take <var>var1</var> mental damage that turn. The duration of this effect depends on the target’s Will save.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 2d8.

name: Air Bubble
shortDesc: React to create air for a creature to breathe.
trigger: A creature within range enters an environment where it can't breathe.
desc: A bubble of pure air appears around the target's head, allowing it to breathe normally. The effect ends as soon as the target returns to an environment where it can breathe normally.

name: Alarm
shortDesc: Be alerted if a creature enters a warded area.
desc: You ward an area to alert you when creatures enter without your permission. When you cast alarm, select a password. Whenever a Small or larger corporeal creature enters the spell's area without speaking the password, alarm sends your choice of a mental alert (in which case the spell gains the mental trait) or an audible alarm with the sound and volume of a hand bell (in which case the spell gains the auditory trait). <var>var1</var>Either option automatically awakens you, and the bell allows each creature in the area to attempt a DC 15 Perception check to wake up. A creature aware of the alarm must succeed at a Stealth check against the spell's DC or trigger the spell when moving into the area.
heightened/0/desc: You can specify criteria for which creatures sound the alarm spell—for instance, orcs or masked people.
desc3/0/value: You can specify criteria for which creatures sound the alarm spell—for instance, orcs or masked people.

name: Ant Haul
shortDesc: Target can carry more.
desc: You reinforce the target's musculoskeletal system to bear more weight. The target can carry 3 more Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered and up to a maximum of 6 more Bulk.

name: Anticipate Peril
shortDesc: You grant the target brief foresight.
desc: You grant the target brief foresight. The target gains a <var>var1</var> status bonus to its next initiative roll, after which the spell ends.
heightened/0/desc: The status bonus increases by 1, to a maximum of +4 at 7th level.

name: Bane
shortDesc: Weaken enemies' attacks in an aura around you.
desc: You fill the minds of your enemies with doubt. Targets that fail their Will saves take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls as long as they are in the area. Once per turn, starting the turn after you cast bane, you can use a single action, which has the concentrate trait, to increase the emanation's radius by 5 feet and force enemies in the area that weren't yet affected to attempt another saving throw. Bane can counteract bless.

name: Befuddle
shortDesc: You sow seeds of confusion in your target's mind, causing their actions and thoughts to become clumsy.
desc: You sow seeds of confusion in your target’s mind, causing their actions and thoughts to become clumsy.
success: The target is clumsy 1 and stupefied 1.
failure: The target is clumsy 2 and stupefied 2.
critfailure: The target is clumsy 3, stupefied 3, and confused.

name: Bless
shortDesc: Strengthen allies' attacks in an aura around you.
targets: you and allies in the area

name: Burning Hands
shortDesc: A small cone of flame rushes from your hands.
desc: Gouts of flame rush from your hands. You deal <var>var1</var> fire damage to creatures in the area.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Charm
shortDesc: A humanoid becomes more friendly to you.
desc:
To the target, your words are honey and your visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if you or your allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. <var>var1</var>

You can Dismiss the spell. If you use hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with you or the actions you convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning you could potentially convince the target to continue being your friend via mundane means.
critsuccess: The target is unaffected and aware you tried to charm it.
success: The target is unaffected but thinks your spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (see Identifying Magic).
failure: The target's attitude becomes friendly toward you. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can't use hostile actions against you.
critfailure: The target's attitude becomes helpful toward you, and it can't use hostile actions against you.
heightened/0/desc: The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.
heightened/1/desc: The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
desc4/0/value: The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations.
desc8/0/value: The duration lasts until the next time you make your daily preparations, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

name: Chilling Spray
shortDesc: A cone of icy shards bursts from your spread hands and coats the target in a layer of frost.
desc: A cone of icy shards bursts from your spread hands and coats the target in a layer of frost. You deal <var>var1</var> cold damage to creatures in the area; they must each attempt a Reflex save.
failure: The creature takes full damage and takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds.
critfailure: The creature takes double damage and takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speeds for 2 rounds.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 2d4.

name: Color Spray
shortDesc: Swirling colors dazzle or stun creatures.
desc: Swirling colors affect viewers based on their Will saves.
success: The creature is dazzled for 1 round.
failure: The creature is stunned 1, blinded for 1 round, and dazzled for 1 minute.
critfailure: The creature is stunned for 1 round and blinded for 1 minute.

name: Command
shortDesc: Bid a creature to approach, run, release something, lie prone, or stand up.
duration: until the end of the target's next turn
desc: You shout a command that's hard to ignore. <var>var1</var>You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), release what it's holding, drop prone, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.
failure: For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.
critfailure: The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.
heightened/0/desc: You can target up to 10 creatures.
desc5/0/value: You can target up to 10 creatures.

name: Create Water
shortDesc: Conjure 2 gallons of water.
desc: As you cup your hands, water begins to flow forth from them. You create 2 gallons of water. If no one drinks it, it evaporates after 1 day.

name: Detect Alignment
shortDesc: See auras of a chosen alignment.
desc:
Your eyes glow as you sense aligned auras. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful. You detect auras of that alignment. <var>var1</var> You can choose not to detect creatures or effects you're aware have that alignment.

Only creatures of 6th level or higher—unless divine spellcasters, undead, or beings from the Outer Sphere—have alignment auras.
heightened/0/desc: You learn each aura's location and strength.
desc1/0/value: You receive no information beyond presence or absence.
desc2/0/value: You learn each aura's location and strength.

name: Detect Poison
shortDesc: Determine whether an object or creature is poisonous or venomous.

name: Disrupting Weapons
shortDesc: Weapons deal positive damage to undead.

name: Endure
shortDesc: You invigorate the touched creature's mind and urge it to press on.
desc: You invigorate the touched creature’s mind and urge it to press on. You grant the touched creature <var>var1</var> temporary Hit Points.
heightened/0/desc: Increase the temporary Hit Points by 5.

name: Exchange Image
shortDesc: Trade appearances with the target.
desc: To mislead pursuers, the Lacunafex developed the means to swap visages. You trade appearances with the target, with the effects depending on the result of the target’s Will saving throw. Willing and unconscious targets automatically critically fail this saving throw.
success: You take on the target’s appearance, and they take yours. This has the same effects as a 1st-level illusory disguise spell, except that the target can’t Dismiss the disguise. The duration is 1 minute or until Dismissed.
failure: As success, but the duration is 1 hour or until Dismissed.
critfailure: As success, but the duration is 24 hours.

name: Fear
shortDesc: Frighten a creature, possibly making it flee.
desc: <var>var1</var>You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.
critfailure: The target is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.
heightened/0/desc: You can target up to five creatures.
desc3/0/value: You can target up to five creatures.

name: Feather Fall
shortDesc: React to slow a creature's fall.
desc: You cause the air itself to arrest a fall. The target's fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If the target reaches the ground while the spell is in effect, it takes no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as the target lands.

name: Fleet Step
shortDesc: Make your Speed much faster.
desc: You gain a +30-foot status bonus to your Speed.

name: Floating Disk
shortDesc: A disk of energy follows you, carrying objects.
desc:
A disk of magical force materializes adjacent to you. This disk is 2 feet in diameter and follows 5 feet behind you, floating just above the ground. It holds up to 5 Bulk of objects (though they must be able to fit and balance on its surface). Any objects atop the disk fall to the ground when the spell ends.

The spell ends if a creature tries to ride atop the disk, if the disk is overloaded, if anyone tries to lift or force the disk higher above the ground, or if you move more than 30 feet away from the disk.

name: Goblin Pox
shortDesc: Infect a creature with goblin pox.
desc: Your touch afflicts the target with goblin pox, an irritating allergenic rash. The target must attempt a Fortitude save. Goblin Pox (disease); Level 1. Goblins and goblin dogs are immune. Stage 1 sickened 1 (1 round); Stage 2 sickened 1 and slowed 1 (1 round); Stage 3 sickened 1 and the creature can't reduce its sickened value below 1 (1 day)
failure: The target is afflicted with goblin pox at stage 1.
critfailure: The target is afflicted with goblin pox at stage 2.

name: Grease
shortDesc: Coat a surface or object in slippery grease.
desc: You conjure grease, with effects based on choosing area or target. Area All solid ground in the area is covered with grease. Each creature standing on the greasy surface must succeed at a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check against your spell DC or fall prone. Creatures using an action to move onto the greasy surface during the spell's duration must attempt either a Reflex save or an Acrobatics check to Balance. A creature that Steps or Crawls doesn't have to attempt a check or save. Target If you cast the spell on an unattended object, anyone trying to pick up the object must succeed at an Acrobatics check or Reflex save against your spell DC to do so. If you target an attended object, the creature that has the object must attempt an Acrobatics check or Reflex save. On a failure, the holder or wielder takes a –2 circumstance penalty to all checks that involve using the object; on a critical failure, the holder or wielder releases the item. The object lands in an adjacent square of the GM's choice. If you cast this spell on a worn object, the wearer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against attempts to grapple them.

name: Grim Tendrils
shortDesc: Creatures in a line take negative damage and bleed.
desc: Tendrils of darkness curl out from your fingertips and race through the air. You deal <var>var1</var> negative damage and <var>var2</var> persistent bleed damage to living creatures in the line. Each living creature in the line must attempt a Fortitude save.
success: The creature takes half the negative damage and no persistent bleed damage.
critfailure: The creature takes double negative damage and double persistent bleed damage.
heightened/0/desc: The negative damage increases by 2d4, and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

name: Gust of Wind
shortDesc: Wind blows out fires and knocks back objects and creatures.
duration: until the start of your next turn
desc: A violent wind issues forth from your palm, blowing from the point where you are when you cast the spell to the line's opposite end. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects. Large or smaller creatures in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Large or smaller creatures that later move into the gust must attempt the save on entering.
success: The creature can't move against the wind.
failure: The creature is knocked prone. If it was flying, it suffers the effects of critical failure instead.
critfailure: The creature is pushed 30 feet in the wind's direction, knocked prone, and takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage.

name: Harm
shortDesc: Negative energy harms the living or heals the undead, either a single creature or all in a burst.

name: Heal
shortDesc: Positive energy heals the living or harms the undead, either a single creature or all in a burst.

name: Hydraulic Push
shortDesc: Damage and push a creature with a blast of water.
desc: You call forth a powerful blast of pressurized water that bludgeons the target and knocks it back. Make a ranged spell attack roll.
critsuccess: The target takes <var>var2</var> bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.
success: The target takes <var>var1</var> bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 2d6.

name: Ill Omen
shortDesc: The target is struck with misfortune, which throws them off balance.
desc: The target is struck with misfortune, which throws them off balance. The target must attempt a Will save.
failure: The first time during the duration that target rolls an attack roll or skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.
critfailure: Every time during the duration that the target rolls an attack roll or skill check, it must roll twice and take the worse result.

name: Illusory Disguise
shortDesc: Make yourself look like a different creature.
desc:
You create an illusion that causes you to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as yourself. <var>var1</var> You can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making your armor look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item you remove returns to its true appearance.

Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties you might take for disguising yourself as a dissimilar creature, it gives you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through your disguise, and you add your level even if you're untrained. You can Dismiss this spell.
heightened/0/desc: The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.
heightened/1/desc: You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.
desc1/0/value: The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms.
desc2/0/value: The disguise is typically good enough to hide your identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait. It doesn't disguise your mannerisms.
desc3/0/value: You can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. You must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait. It doesn't disguise your mannerisms.

name: Illusory Object
shortDesc: Form a convincing illusion of an object.
desc:
You create an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. <var>var1</var>

Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve your illusion.
heightened/0/desc: Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration increases to 1 hour.
heightened/1/desc: As the 2nd-level version, but the duration is unlimited.
desc1/0/value: The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.
desc2/0/value: Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration increases to 1 hour.
desc5/0/value: Your image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory trait. The duration is unlimited.

name: Imprint Message
shortDesc: Imprint a psychic message into an object.
desc: You project psychic vibrations onto the target object, imprinting it with a short message or emotional theme of your design. This imprinted sensation is revealed to anyone casting object reading on the target object, replacing any emotional events the item was present for. If the object is in the area of a retrocognition spell, the imprinted messages appear as major events in the timeline, but they don’t interfere with any other visions. If the object is targeted with read aura of a higher spell level than imprint message, the caster learns that the object has been modified. When you Cast this Spell, any prior vibrations placed in an object by previous castings of imprint message fade.

name: Item Facade
shortDesc: Disguise an item to look perfect or shoddy.
targets: 1 object no more than 10 feet by 10 feet by 10 feet
desc: You make the target object look and feel as though it were in much better or worse physical condition. <var>var1</var>When you cast this spell, decide whether you want to make the object look decrepit or perfect. An item made to look decrepit appears broken and shoddy. An intact item made to look better appears as though it's brand new and highly polished or well maintained. A broken item appears to be intact and functional. Destroyed items can't be affected by this spell. A creature that Interacts with the item can attempt to disbelieve the illusion.
heightened/0/desc: The duration is 24 hours.

name: Jump
shortDesc: Make an impressive leap.
desc: <var>var1</var>Your legs surge with strength, ready to leap high and far. You jump 30 feet in any direction without touching the ground. You must land on a space of solid ground within 30 feet of you, or else you fall after using your next action.
heightened/0/desc: The range becomes touch, the target changes to one touched creature, and the duration becomes 1 minute, allowing the target to jump as described whenever it takes the Leap action.
desc3/0/value: The range becomes touch, the target changes to one touched creature, and the duration becomes 1 minute, allowing the target to jump as described whenever it takes the Leap action.

name: Liberating Command
shortDesc: You call out a liberating cry, urging an ally to break free of an effect that holds them in place.
desc: You call out a liberating cry, urging an ally to break free of an effect that holds them in place. If the target is grabbed, immobilized, or restrained, it can immediately use a reaction to attempt to Escape.

name: Lock
shortDesc: Make a lock hard to open.
targets: 1 lock, or a door or container with a latch
desc:
<var>var1</var>The target's latch mechanism clinks shut, held fast by unseen magical restraints. When you magically lock a target, you set an Athletics and Thievery DC to open it equal to your spell DC or the base lock DC with a +4 status bonus, whichever is higher. Any key or combination that once opened a lock affected by this spell does not do so for the duration of the spell, though the key or combination does grant a +4 circumstance bonus to checks to open the door.

If the target is opened, the spell ends. Assuming the target is not barred or locked in some additional way, you can unlock and open it with an Interact action during which you touch the target. This does not end the spell. You can Dismiss this spell at any time and from any distance.
heightened/0/desc: The duration increases to unlimited, but you must expend 6 gp worth of gold dust as an additional cost.
desc2/0/value: The duration increases to unlimited, but you must expend 6 gp worth of gold dust as an additional cost.

name: Longstrider
shortDesc: Increase your Speed for an hour.
desc: <var>var1</var>You lengthen your stride beyond what should be possible. You gain a +10-foot status bonus to your Speed.
heightened/0/desc: The duration increases to 8 hours.

name: Mage Armor
shortDesc: Ward yourself with magical armor.
duration: until the next time you make your daily preparations
desc: You ward yourself with shimmering magical energy, gaining a <var>var1</var> item bonus to AC and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. <var>var2</var>While wearing mage armor, you use your unarmored proficiency to calculate your AC.
heightened/0/desc: You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.
heightened/1/desc: The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.
heightened/2/desc: The item bonus to AC increases to +2, and you gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.
heightened/3/desc: The item bonus to AC increases to +3, and you gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.
desc4/1/value: You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.
desc6/1/value: You gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws.
desc8/1/value: You gain a +2 item bonus to saving throws.
desc10/1/value: You gain a +3 item bonus to saving throws.

name: Magic Aura
shortDesc: Change how an item's magic appears to detecting spells.
duration: until the next time you make your daily preparations
desc:
You alter the appearance of an item's magic aura. You can choose to have the target's aura appear as that of common magic item of twice magic aura's level or lower, or to have it register as being under the effects of a spell of your choice of magic aura's level or lower. If the target is magical, you can instead choose to have it appear as entirely non-magical. <var>var1</var>

A caster using detect magic or read aura of an equal or higher spell level can attempt to disbelieve the illusion from magic aura. Magic aura doesn't mask the aura of spells that are 9th level or higher or of items that are 19th level or higher.
heightened/0/desc: You can target a creature instead of an object. When you do, you can either conceal the auras of all magic items it has or have that creature's aura appear as if it were under the effect of a spell you know.
desc3/0/value: You can target a creature instead of an object. When you do, you can either conceal the auras of all magic items it has or have that creature's aura appear as if it were under the effect of a spell you know.

name: Magic Fang
shortDesc: Make a creature's unarmed attacks magical temporarily.

name: Magic Missile
shortDesc: Pelt creatures with unerring bolts of magical force.
desc: You send <var>var1</var> of force streaking toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of missiles you shoot by <var>var2</var>, to a maximum of <var>var3</var> missiles for 3 actions. You choose the target for each missile individually. If you shoot more than one missile at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.
heightened/0/desc: You shoot one additional missile with each action you spend.

name: Magic Weapon
shortDesc: Make a weapon temporarily magical.
targets: 1 non-magical weapon that is unattended or wielded by you or a willing ally
desc: The weapon glimmers with magic and energy. The target becomes a +1 striking weapon, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two.

name: Mending
shortDesc: Repair one non-magical item.
targets: non-magical object of light Bulk or less
desc: <var>var1</var>You repair the target item. You restore 5 Hit Points per spell level to the target, potentially removing the broken condition if this repairs it past the item's Broken Threshold. You can't replace lost pieces or repair an object that's been completely destroyed.
heightened/0/desc: You can target a non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less.
heightened/1/desc: You can target a non-magical object of 2 Bulk or less, or a magical object of 1 Bulk or less.
desc2/0/value: You can target a non-magical object of 1 Bulk or less.
desc3/0/value: You can target a non-magical object of 2 Bulk or less, or a magical object of 1 Bulk or less.

name: Message Rune
shortDesc: You record a message up to 5 minutes long and inscribe a special rune on any flat unattended surface within reach.
desc: You record a message up to 5 minutes long and inscribe a special rune on any flat unattended surface within reach. The nature of the rune’s appearance is up to you, but it is visible to everyone and it must be no smaller than 2 inches in diameter. You also specify a trigger that creatures must meet to activate the rune. For the duration of the spell, creatures who meet the criteria of the trigger can touch the rune to hear the recorded message in their head as though you were speaking to them telepathically. You know when someone is listening to the message, but you do not know who is listening to it. You can Dismiss the spell.

name: Mindlink
shortDesc: Mentally impart 10 minutes' worth of information in an instant.
desc: You link your mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

name: Negate Aroma
shortDesc: Suppress a creature's scent.

name: Pass without Trace
shortDesc: Make your tracks hard to find.

name: Penumbral Shroud
shortDesc: You envelop the target in a shroud of shadow.

name: Pest Form
shortDesc: Turn into a nonthreatening animal.
desc:
You transform into a the battle form of a Tiny animal, such as a cat, insect, lizard, or rat. <var>var1</var>You can decide the specific type of animal (such as a rat or praying mantis), but this has no effect on the form's Size or statistics. While in this form, you gain the animal trait. You can Dismiss the spell.

You gain the following statistics and abilities:

AC = 15 + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction.
Speed 10 feet.
Weakness 5 to physical damage. (If you take physical damage in this form, you take 5 additional damage.)
Low-Light Vision and imprecise scent 30 feet.
Acrobatics and Stealth modifiers of +10, unless your own modifier is higher; Athletics modifier -4.
heightened/0/desc: You can turn into a flying creature, such as a bird, which grants you a fly Speed of 20 feet.
desc4/0/value: You can turn into a flying creature, such as a bird, which grants you a fly Speed of 20 feet.

name: Phantom Pain
shortDesc: Cause a creature ongoing pain that sickens it.

name: Protection
shortDesc: Shield a creature against those of a chosen alignment.

name: Purify Food and Drink
shortDesc: Make beverages and meals safe.
targets: 1 cubic foot of contaminated food or water
desc: You remove toxins and contaminations from food and drink, making them safe to consume. This spell doesn't prevent future contamination, natural decay, or spoilage. One cubic foot of liquid is roughly 8 gallons.

name: Ray of Enfeeblement
shortDesc: Sap a creature's strength.

name: Sanctuary
shortDesc: Protect a creature from being attacked.

name: Share Lore
shortDesc: You share your knowledge with the touched creatures.

name: Shattering Gem
shortDesc: A large gem floats around the target in an erratic pattern.

name: Shillelagh
shortDesc: Make a club or staff temporarily magical, and deal more damage to unnatural creatures.

name: Shocking Grasp
shortDesc: Zap a creature with electricity.
desc: You shroud your hands in a crackling field of lightning. Make a melee spell attack roll. On a hit, the target takes <var>var1</var> electricity damage. If the target is wearing metal armor or is made of metal, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll with shocking grasp, and the target also takes <var>var2</var> persistent electricity damage on a hit. On a critical hit, double the initial damage, but not the persistent damage.
heightened/0/desc: The damage increases by 1d12, and the persistent electricity damage increases by 1.

name: Shockwave
shortDesc: You create a wave of energy that ripples through the earth.

name: Sleep
shortDesc: Cause creatures in a small area to fall asleep.
desc: Each creature in the area becomes drowsy and might fall asleep. A creature that falls unconscious from this spell doesn't fall prone or release what it's holding. This spell doesn't prevent creatures from waking up due to a successful Perception check, limiting its utility in combat.
success: The creature takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks for 1 round.
heightened/0/desc: The creatures fall unconscious for 1 round on a failure or 1 minute on a critical failure. They fall prone and release what they're holding, and they can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.
desc1/0/value: The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 minute, it wakes up automatically.
desc1/1/value: The creature falls unconscious. If it's still unconscious after 1 hour, it wakes up automatically.
desc4/0/value: The creatures falls unconscious for 1 round. It falls prone and releases what it's holding, and it can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.
desc4/1/value: The creatures falls unconscious for 1 minute. It falls prone and releases what it's holding, and it can't attempt Perception checks to wake up. When the duration ends, the creature is sleeping normally instead of automatically waking up.

name: Snowball
shortDesc: You throw a magically propelled and chilled ball of dense snow.

name: Soothe
shortDesc: Heal the target and bolster them against mental attacks.

name: Spider Sting
shortDesc: Damage a creature and afflict it with spider venom.

name: Spirit Link
shortDesc: Continually transfer your health to someone else.

name: Summon Animal
shortDesc: Conjure an animal to fight on your behalf.

name: Summon Construct
shortDesc: Conjure a construct to fight on your behalf.

name: Summon Fey
shortDesc: Conjure a fey to fight on your behalf.

name: Summon Plant or Fungus
shortDesc: Conjure a plant or fungus to fight on your behalf.

name: Temporary Tool
shortDesc: You conjure a temporary simple tool, such as a shovel or rope into your hands.

name: Tether
shortDesc: You use magical chains, vines, or other tethers to bind your target to you.

name: True Strike
shortDesc: Make your next attack especially accurate.

name: Unseen Servant
shortDesc: Create an invisible creature to help you.

name: Ventriloquism
shortDesc: Throw your voice.

name: Acid Arrow
shortDesc: Magical arrow deals acid damage persistently.

name: Animal Form
shortDesc: Turn into a dangerous animal.

name: Animal Messenger
shortDesc: Send a Tiny animal to deliver a message.

name: Animus Mine
shortDesc: You implant a mental mine within your psyche that detonates against anyone attempting to manipulate your thoughts.

name: Augury
shortDesc: Predict whether a course of action brings good fortune.

name: Barkskin
shortDesc: Target's skin is covered in protective bark.

name: Blur
shortDesc: Cause a target's form to become blurry and hard to hit.

name: Brand the Impenitent
shortDesc: You brand the target with an ethereal copy of your deity's religious symbol.

name: Calm Emotions
shortDesc: Suppress strong emotions and hostility.

name: Comprehend Language
shortDesc: A creature understands one language.

name: Continual Flame
shortDesc: A magical flame burns indefinitely.

name: Create Food
shortDesc: Conjure food that can feed multiple creatures.
desc: You create enough food to feed <var>var1</var> Medium creatures for a day. This food is bland and unappealing, but it is nourishing. After 1 day, if no one has eaten the food, it decays and becomes inedible. Most Small creatures eat one-quarter as much as a Medium creature (one-sixteenth as much for most Tiny creatures), and most Large creatures eat 10 times as much (100 times as much for Huge creatures and so on).
heightened/0/desc: You can feed 12 Medium creatures.

name: Darkness
shortDesc: Suppress all light in an area.

name: Darkvision
shortDesc: See in the dark.

name: Deafness
shortDesc: Make a creature deaf.

name: Death Knell
shortDesc: Finish off a creature who's near death.

name: Dispel Magic
shortDesc: End a spell or suppress an item's magic.

name: Endure Elements
shortDesc: Protect a creature from severe cold or heat.

name: Enhance Victuals
shortDesc: Improve food or drink and remove poisons.

name: Enlarge
shortDesc: A creature grows in size.

name: Entangle
shortDesc: Plants in an area grow to entangle and immobilize.

name: Expeditious Excavation
shortDesc: You remove loose dirt, dust, gravel, sand, and the like from the area.

name: Faerie Fire
shortDesc: Colorful light prevents creatures from being concealed or invisible.

name: False Life
shortDesc: Gain temporary HP.

name: Feast of Ashes
shortDesc: You curse the target with a hunger no food can sate.

name: Flaming Sphere
shortDesc: A ball of fire rolls about at your command.

name: Fungal Hyphae
shortDesc: Thin hyphae grow from your feet and plunge into the earth.

name: Gentle Repose
shortDesc: A corpse doesn't decay and can't become undead.

name: Ghoulish Cravings
shortDesc: Infect a creature with ghoul fever.

name: Glitterdust
shortDesc: Sparkling dust breaks invisibility and impedes vision.

name: Hideous Laughter
shortDesc: Fits of laughter make a creature unable to take all its actions.

name: Humanoid Form
shortDesc: Take the shape of a humanoid.

name: Illusory Creature
shortDesc: Form a convincing illusion of a creature.

name: Invisibility
shortDesc: A creature can't be seen until it attacks.

name: Iron Gut
shortDesc: Your mouth, esophagus, and stomach become incredibly elastic and tougher than metal.

name: Knock
shortDesc: Make a door, lock, or container easier to open, and possibly open it immediately.
desc:
You make the target easier to open. Knock grants a +4 status bonus to any creature that tries to open the target door, lock, or container with an Athletics or a Thievery check. You can attempt a Thievery check to open the target as part of casting knock, and you add your level even if you're untrained.

Knock counteracts lock.

name: Magic Mouth
shortDesc: Make an illusory mouth appear to speak a message.

name: Mirror Image
shortDesc: Illusory duplicates of you cause attacks to miss.

name: Misdirection
shortDesc: Cause one creature's auras to appear to be another's.

name: Obscuring Mist
shortDesc: Conceal creatures in a cloud of mist.

name: Paranoia
shortDesc: Make a creature believe everyone is a threat.

name: Phantom Steed
shortDesc: Conjure a magical horse.

name: Remove Fear
shortDesc: Free a creature from its fright.

name: Remove Paralysis
shortDesc: Free a creature from paralysis.
desc: <var>var1</var>A surge of energy frees a paralyzed creature. You can attempt to counteract a single effect imposing the paralyzed condition on the target. This does not cure someone who is paralyzed from some natural state or effect, such as paralysis caused by non-magical wounds or toxins.
heightened/0/desc: The spell's range increases to 30 feet, and you can target up to 10 creatures.
desc6/0/value: The spell's range increases to 30 feet, and you can target up to 10 creatures.

name: Resist Energy
shortDesc: Protect a creature from one type of energy damage.

name: Restoration
shortDesc: Reduce a condition or lessen a toxin.

name: Restore Senses
shortDesc: Remove a blinding or deafening effect.

name: See Invisibility
shortDesc: See invisible creatures and objects.

name: Shape Wood
shortDesc: Reshape unworked wood as you choose.

name: Shatter
shortDesc: Shatter an object with a high-frequency sonic attack.

name: Shield Other
shortDesc: Absorb half the damage an ally would take.

name: Shrink
shortDesc: Reduce a willing creature to Tiny size.

name: Silence
shortDesc: Mute all sound from a creature.

name: Slough Skin
shortDesc: You continually and harmlessly slough off the top layer of your skin while new skin regenerates immediately.

name: Sound Burst
shortDesc: Damage and deafen creatures with a powerful din.

name: Speak with Animals
shortDesc: Communicate with animals.
desc: You can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals. The spell doesn't make them more friendly than normal. Cunning animals are likely to be terse and evasive, while less intelligent ones often make inane comments.

name: Spectral Hand
shortDesc: Create a semicorporeal hand that touches creatures to target them with your spells.

name: Spider Climb
shortDesc: Give a creature a climb Speed.

name: Spiritual Weapon
shortDesc: Materialize a deific weapon of force that appears and attacks repeatedly.

name: Status
shortDesc: Keep track of a willing creature's location and well-being.

name: Summon Elemental
shortDesc: Conjure an elemental to fight on your behalf.

name: Telekinetic Maneuver
shortDesc: Disarm, Shove, or Trip a creature telekinetically.

name: Touch of Idiocy
shortDesc: Dull a target's mind with a touch.

name: Tree Shape
shortDesc: Turn into a tree.

name: Undetectable Alignment
shortDesc: Make a creature or object appear neutral to alignment detection.

name: Water Breathing
shortDesc: Allow creatures to breathe underwater.

name: Water Walk
shortDesc: Buoy a creature so it can walk on water.

name: Web
shortDesc: Form a web that keeps creatures from moving.

name: Animal Vision
shortDesc: Project your senses through an animal.

name: Bind Undead
shortDesc: Take control of a mindless undead.

name: Blindness
shortDesc: Strike a target blind.

name: Chilling Darkness
shortDesc: Ray of evil darkness deals cold damage, counteracts light, and harms celestials.

name: Circle of Protection
shortDesc: A creature emits an aura that protects those within against an alignment.

name: Clairaudience
shortDesc: Hear through an invisible magical sensor.

name: Crisis of Faith
shortDesc: Cause mental damage and possibly make a worshipper unable to cast spells.

name: Cup of Dust
shortDesc: You curse the target with a thirst no drink can quench.

name: Dream Message
shortDesc: Send a message that arrives in a dream.

name: Earthbind
shortDesc: Bring a flying creature to the ground.

name: Enthrall
shortDesc: Your speech makes creatures fascinated with you.

name: Feet to Fins
shortDesc: Turn a creature's feet into fins, enabling it swim but slowing it on land.

name: Fireball
shortDesc: An explosion of fire in an area burns creatures.

name: Ghostly Weapon
shortDesc: Make a weapon affect incorporeal creatures.

name: Glyph of Warding
shortDesc: Store a spell in a symbol to make a trap.

name: Gravity Well
shortDesc: You create a sphere of altered gravity.

name: Ethereal Jaunt
shortDesc: Use the Ethereal Plane to move through objects and into the air.
desc:
<var>var1</var>You travel to the Ethereal Plane, which overlaps the Material Plane. Material Plane creatures can't see you, and you can move through things on the Material Plane. You move at half your normal Speeds, but can move in any direction (including up and down).

You can see onto the Material Plane within a radius of 60 feet; it is gray, hazy, and concealed from you. You can't affect the Material Plane, and you can't be affected by the Material Plane except by force effects and abjurations originating there.

When the spell ends, you return to the Material Plane. If you're in the air, you fall (unless you can fly), and if you're inside an object, you're pushed into the nearest open space and take 1d6 damage per 5 feet you were pushed.

If you cast this spell when not on the Material Plane, it is lost.
